intro: Sorocea macrogyna, commonly known as the large-fruited sorocea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are broad and ovate, with a smooth texture. Sorocea macrogyna produces large, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds, aiding in its propagation.
